title: Aamir Khan Productions breaks silence over ‘Laapataa Ladies’ Oscars 2025 snub - The Hindu
summary:
Aamir Khan Productions Reacts to 'Laapataa Ladies' Oscars 2025 Snub

Published: December 18, 2024, Source: The Hindu

Aamir Khan Productions has issued an official statement following the exclusion of Laapataa Ladies from the Oscars 2025 shortlist for Best International Feature Film. The Film Federation of India’s decision to bypass the Kiran Rao-directed satire sparked significant backlash among cinephiles and industry figures alike.

  • The film, which critiques the patriarchy in rural India, was critically acclaimed but not shortlisted for the Oscars.
  • Aamir Khan Productions expressed disappointment but emphasized gratitude for the support received.
  • The statement highlighted the honor of being considered among the finest films globally, despite the snub.
  • Critics have raised concerns about the selection criteria of the Film Federation of India.
  • The situation has drawn attention back to Payal Kapadia’s Cannes-winning film, All We Imagine As Light, viewed as India’s strongest contender.
“Laapataa Ladies did not make it to the Academy Awards shortlist this year, and we are of course disappointed, but equally we are immensely grateful for the incredible support and belief we’ve received throughout this journey.”

The exclusion of Laapataa Ladies adds another chapter to India’s contentious history with the Academy Awards.
newTitle: Aamir Khan Productions Reacts to 'Laapataa Ladies' Oscars 2025 Snub

This record-breaking achievement highlights the franchise's immense popularity and the growing success of dubbed South Indian films in Hindi cinema.

Nalini Unagar, a YouTuber known for her cooking channel, announced she is quitting content creation after investing over Rs 8 lakh without any return on her investment. She has deleted all her videos and is selling her kitchen accessories and equipment.

  • Nalini invested Rs 8 lakh over three years on her channel, 'Nalini's Kitchen Recipe'.
  • Despite creating over 250 videos, she received no income from YouTube.
  • Her decision to quit has sparked discussions about the challenges of online content creation.
  • Online users have expressed support and advice regarding her struggles.
“I failed in my YouTube career, so I’m selling all my kitchen accessories and studio equipment. If anyone is interested in buying, please let me know,” - Nalini Unagar.

title: Pushpa 2 Stampede: 9-year-old boy injured during screening at Sandhya Theatre declared brain dead - India TV News
summary:
Pushpa 2 Stampede: 9-year-old boy injured during screening at Sandhya Theatre declared brain dead

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

A tragic incident occurred during the midnight screening of Pushpa 2 at the Sandhya Theatre in Hyderabad, where a 9-year-old boy named Sri Teja was injured and later declared brain dead due to lack of breathing. The incident raised concerns over crowd management at such events, leading to police and government officials visiting the hospital to inquire about his condition.

  • The boy sustained serious injuries during the screening and had been on ventilator support.
  • A stampede erupted after actor Allu Arjun's arrival, resulting in chaos and injuries.
  • A woman named Revathy tragically lost her life in the stampede.
  • Pushpa 2 is performing exceptionally well at the box office, grossing over Rs 1,400 crore globally.
“We are monitoring the health condition of Shri Teja regularly and hope for his speedy recovery.” - Health Secretary Dr. Christina

This incident highlights the risks associated with large public gatherings and the importance of safety measures in place to prevent such tragedies in the future.
newTitle: Tragic Incident During Pushpa 2 Screening Leaves Boy Brain Dead

title: Pushpa 2 stampede: Hyderabad theatre gets show cause notice after woman's death - India Today
summary:
Hyderabad Theatre Issues Notice After Pushpa 2 Stampede Death

Published On: Dec 18, 2024

Source: India Today

Following a tragic stampede during the screening of Pushpa 2, Hyderabad police have issued a notice to Sandhya Theatre management over multiple management lapses that led to a woman's death.

  • The theatre management has been issued a show cause notice citing 11 lapses during the screening.
  • The management allegedly failed to inform local authorities about actor Allu Arjun's arrival prior to the incident.
  • Improper entry, exit, and seating arrangements were cited as significant failures.
  • Management encouraged crowding with unauthorized large advertisements outside the theatre.
  • Sufficient security measures were not in place, contributing to the chaos.
A 39-year-old woman named Revathi died during the stampede, while her son was critically injured.

The police warned that the theatre must respond within 10 days or they risk having their Cinematograph License revoked.
newTitle: Hyderabad Theatre Issues Notice After Pushpa 2 Stampede Death
